PRINT THIS New York nyamag.com Features The Fantasist Please place in Jeffrey Epstein File. Thank you. Accused of paying underage girls for sex, superrich money manager Jeffrey Epstein is finding that living in a dream world is dangerous—even if you can pay for it. By Philip Weiss Published Dec 10, 2007 Jeffrey Epstein is under indictment for sex crimes in Palm Beach, Florida, and I'd expected that when he came into the office of PR guru Howard Rubenstein, he would be sober and reserved. Quite the opposite. He was sparkling and ingenuous, apologizing for the half-hour lateness with a charming line—"I never realized bow many one-way streets and no-right-turns there are in midtown. I finally got out to talk to many of my friends?" Epstein had been supplying me the phone numbers of important scientists and financiers and media figures. text_blocks.content: Accused of paying underage girls for sex, superrich money manager Jeffrey Epstein is finding that living in a dream world is dangerous—even if you can pay for it.

Jeffrey Epstein is under indictment for sex crimes in Palm Beach, Florida, and I'd expected that when he came into the office of PR guru Howard Rubenstein, he would be sober and reserved. Quite the opposite. He was sparkling and ingenuous, apologizing for the half-hour lateness with a charming line—"I never realized bow many one-way streets and no-right-turns there are in midtown. I finally got out to talk to many of my friends?" Epstein had been supplying me the phone numbers of important scientists and financiers and media figures. "Do you understand what an extraordinary group of people
TO: Attorney Lanna Belohlavek SP: Ms. Carolyn Lowe. Please place in Jeffrey Epstein File. Thank you.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a faxed copy of an article from New York Magazine. The handwritten note at the top suggests that it was sent to an attorney's office. The document is generally clear, but there are some minor creases and fax artifacts visible.
